item.title: Peer helping
item.description: A variety of interpersonal helping behaviours assumed by trained individuals who undertake a helping role with others On the basis that many individuals (especially students) are likely to first turn to their peers for help before approaching a trusted adult [[Ethics]] and boundaries play an important role in peer helping to protect both the helper and the helpee
